title: How I Find $5k+/Month Book Topics (Amazon KDP Keyword Research)

tactics.name: bestseller_category_scanning
tactics.description: Identify potential book topics by analyzing Amazon bestseller categories and recording relevant keywords.
steps: Open incognito browser to avoid search result skewing
Record potential topics from book titles in spreadsheet
caveats: Avoid shallow research; spend time to find undervalued topics
source_quotes: we do not create a book and then find a keywords for our book to rank hunter. Do not do this.

tactics.name: validate_demand
tactics.description: Use BSR and review counts to identify topics with proven sales potential
steps: Identify books with 250 reviews or less and BSR under 25,000
Look for balance between winning books and dead books
source_quotes: The biggest thing I see with people who their books just aren't selling is the demand is too low.

tactics.name: dead_book_check
tactics.description: Identify non-selling books with reviews to gauge keyword viability
steps: Count reviews on first page of search results
Exclude books with 25+ reviews but no sales
caveats: Fails in saturated markets with 15+ pages of books
source_quotes: There's 15 dead books... no world would this be a good topic

tactics.name: authority_figure_analysis
steps: Assess their relevance to search terms
caveats: Experts with low reviews are still beatable
source_quotes: If an expert has 150 reviews, I'll beat them

tactics.name: metric-based keyword validation
tactics.description: Use spreadsheet metrics to determine keyword viability by analyzing search volume, BSR rank, review counts, and book-topic alignment
caveats: Does not account for new releases
source_quotes: an authority figure is a book that has over 500 to 1,000 reviews where we cannot compete with them
the reason I like the book beam tool is it actually tells you how much money this book is making

heuristics.name: review_volume_filter
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize topic
source_quotes: we want to prove that people are already buying that topic

heuristics.name: winning_book_heuristic
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, boost topic
source_quotes: We want to find some books with lower reviews with a low bestseller rank telling us that it is possible to sell

heuristics.name: low_review_boost
source_quotes: These are books with literally thousands of reviews... making no money

heuristics.name: low review filter
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keyword
source_quotes: there are a ton of books with low reviews that aren't selling
there's no books with low reviews selling

claims.statement: Amazon customers search for specific problem-solution pairs when purchasing books
source_quotes: they are shopping specifically searching up what they are looking for or the problem they're looking to solve

claims.statement: Demand is the single most important factor for book success on Amazon
source_quotes: Demand is the single most important thing when it comes to finding a winning book topic on Amazon

claims.statement: Books with thousands of reviews often generate less than $16/day
source_quotes: $2 a day, $16 a day, $12 a day... thousands of reviews

claims.statement: Topics with 7+ authority figures (500+ reviews) are saturated and cannot be competed
source_quotes: there are over seven authority figures, books that have over 500 reviews
in no actual world would you ever sell on this topic

niche_patterns.description: Targets underserved audiences with specific needs and limitations
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates niche demand with limited competition
source_quotes: we want to prove that it's not too competitive and we can actually sell
